Reviews.Title: “MOUSE IN MY ROOM”
Reviews.Author: lbozzer
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE - woke up to a mouse on the bedside table. Turned on the light and it ran INTO THE BED. TERRIBLE HOTEL. Unsanitary rooms and awful customer service. When I called the front desk, they said there were no rooms to move me to and they would consider giving me a discount for the night. They expected me to stay in the room and acted as if there was nothing wrong. When I heard this, I walked down the hall and saw at least 3 rooms with their curtains open - EMPTY. I called back and they said that these rooms were on hold. I had to argue with them for 10 minutes before they agreed to move me. Unfortunately, all the other hotels in the area were sold out otherwise I would have moved right away.

Reviews.Title: “Door is open in the middle of sleeping”
Reviews.Author: inchunpd
Reviews.Content: I was sleeping an somebody open the door. When i do appeal to front desk, employee said it is not a big deal. What if it happened to women, she could have heart attack.

Reviews.Title: “Dark and Dingy, Awful customer care”
Reviews.Author: kely1866
Reviews.Content: This is an awful hotel. The hotel outside looks dingy and worn;the inside is no better. Carpets look as though they need a good cleaning. This is the type of hotel that offers no customer service. I needed to print out something for a business function and was rudely informed that the printer was only for boarding passes and nothing else. Front desk staff seems very pained to do their jobs and are often not there. When this issue was brought to the attention of the manager, she was clearly indifferent. Save the headache and go somewhere that doesn't feel so much like a Super 8 Motel

Reviews.Title: “Convient”
Reviews.Author: leyabia
Reviews.Content: The Ramada is a very nice hotel I call it my home away from home the pricing is very affordable.and the rooms are very clean and comfortable I love staying there if I could I would stay there all the time if anyoneis in baltimore and want someplace nice byt cheap stay here

Reviews.Title: “Think of 1970!”
Reviews.Author: kimba1910
Reviews.Content: Were at this hotel right now, I mean motel, I have never stayed in a place with the ironing board, hangers & ice tray in the bathroom, I'm in total shock, never again, hotwire needs to remove this place off of their website!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything Fine except the Bed”
Reviews.Author: Alwaysamused
Reviews.Content: The Pros: Clean and Tidy Room Furniture all looked newer (except tv) It was 20 deg. outside but room was very toasty Responsive thermostat on heater/ac unit Great Pillows Hot, Hot water No noise from outside or neighbors (though to be fair don't think we had neighbors either) Breakfast was Good (though mostly sugar and sweets with healthy option being bagels) Convenient to anything you would need, walmart 1 block away, food options, shopping mall nearby Neighborhood felt safe and secure Clean sheets and bedding The Cons: An extra firm bed (actually left my shoulder aching for a few days - and I'm not an old man) Water came from both showerhead and tub faucet at same time but at different temperatures Since Bathtub didn't drain well my feet got very hot from tub faucet spurting scalding water while shower gave warm water Really bad old tv set, muddled sound, blurry picture Would I do it again? Probably not, but only because I don't know what I would do about the bed. Everything else can be overlooked but the bed is essential. Out of all the hotels I researched in this area it was really hard to find one with reviews that didn't scare ya half to death.

Reviews.Title: “Learn From Our Mistake”
Reviews.Author: IWantMyMTV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this "hotel" because it was very close to the place we needed to be. Don't let the picture fool you, there is no lobby other than two small glass walkways, one leading to the check-in counter and the opposite door leading to a vending machine. You drive your car around to the door of the room you have booked. It is a motel that was slightly converted and has the Ramada name attached to it. The name Ramada suggests a nice place to stay, but this was seedy from the start. Although it is not in the shadiest part of town, it is not in the greatest looking area, either. There is a major highway leading into the city itself running outside of the hotel, but don't be fooled, there are plenty of sketchy characters who appear as though they are engaged in somewhat questionable activities mulling about in the area. Although the room appeared clean, the toilet looked to have what appeared to be drops of urine on the toilet seat although the bathroom smelled like bleach. We chose a non-smoking room, but the smell of smoke through the vent wafted in throughout the night. The cleaning staff spoke very little English, and although we tried very hard to be sympathetic, we spent about five minutes talking with the cleaning staff but not understanding or being able to communicate to each other. Finally, they left towels and moved on. We spent one night and were so skeeved out and generally disappointed that we left the next morning after our meeting even though we were scheduled for two more nights. Overall, the hotel left much to be desired. The uneasy feeling that we could not place that we had about the hotel is what caused us to find a Marriott and then shower until our skin peeled. DO NOT waste your money on this "hotel!"

Reviews.Title: “Very impressed with everything”
Reviews.Author: katnkradle
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband, teen daughter, 2 younger sons, and my mother. .We chose the hotel because it was in our price range and close to Baltimore city. My kids had a great time in the pool. The rooms were impeccably clean. We were there 3 days, and had maid service, clean towels and linens, and the continental breakfast each day. The staff was courteous and very helpful. I definitely will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a inn or hotel .....but a motel”
Reviews.Author: MSH059
Reviews.Content: My wife and I where helping our daughter move into thier new home. We were looking for clean hotel close to thier new home that was wallet friendly for one night. We have had good luck at Ramada hotels before and this one was $65 for a Friday night which is very resonable for a hotel room so we booked it. I always prefer to call the hotel directly. When I did I had a devil of a time understanding what the desk clerk on the phone was trying to tell me. He was not friendly and seemed some what irritated that I could not understand his very broken English. When we arrived to check in the transaction was done through bullet proof glass which was a first for us. Warning lights started to go off in my head. Again the check in clerk acted like he was bored and tired and just wated to get us out of his hair. I was ready to turn around and go someplace else; however, it was 10 PM so we were just hoped for a clean room to get some sleep. What we learned is that Ramada Limited is simply a "motel". We drove our car around to our room door. The door could only be opened by kicking it in. Once in the room we found it very clean but it had a bit of a funky smell. There wa no refridge. The bathroom was divided between two areas. One was not much bigger then a closet that contained the toilet and tub/shower. We laughed at how hard it was to attempt to close that door and attempt to dry after a shower......so we just left it opened. The shower was clean and worked well. The original toilet tank top I guess was broken because the current top was not the right size so you could see into the tank. My wife was able to connect to the wireless internet that the "motel" offered; however, the signal was very weak and would drop out at tmes so she gave up. There was the usual array of soaps, shampoos, and coffee pot all nicely arranged, The bed was very comfortable so we slept well. There is Bob Evan's and Arby's no more then a 5 minute walk away. Dispite the bullet proof glass the area in general looked fairly safe to me without any noise that we could hear over our air conditioner. Our AC although very noisy worked nicely. All and all if we again find ourselves in a situation where we must choose between a a Ramada limited or a motel we would stay at the motel and get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “It's under my expectation”
Reviews.Author: Wayneness32
Reviews.Content: Before I booked, I check a trip advisor which is shown great average, though other websites suggested not good place to stay. However, I just reserved due to its cheap price. As a result, I would not recommend anyone to stay there because First of all, the hotel looks like highway motel (looks cheap). Second, it has bad smell when entering a room. Actually this is because there is no openable windows. It just has big large window covered by a curtain. You can just slide a curtain but nothing you can handle the window. Third, you can use free internet, but it's too~~~ slow. TV is almost gone. I was surprised when turning on the TV. It had strange loud noise when I switched a channel. Iron board is toooo dirty. Fourth, breakfast is not good. It only provides some beverages, murpins, and cereals. Fifth, it's far from BWI and downtown and no suitable public transportation near there. I used a taxi to be there (cost over $40). Next day I tried to head for downtown. I knew there is a bus line, but it took almost 20 minutes walk to be the bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “In Catonsville (not Baltimore really) and not great”
Reviews.Author: MoopMeep
Reviews.Content: Oh dear. This hotel is fairly cheap ($65/night +tax) but you are better off dishing out an extra $20 for something a little better. Below is a photo of what I thought was my least favorite thing in our room - the coffee pot counter. But in the morning I realized my least favorite thing was the fact that I had to throw away a pair of socks after walking on the carpet in them for one night. They were totally un-salvagable! As it turned out, the motel was scheduled to get the carpets cleaned this week, but we had the unfortunate experience of understanding first hand what motel carpets look like when they haven’t been deep-cleaned in 6 months. Oh - and there was a bug in our room with overly-active antenae.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: hmlq2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ramada in Baltimore for two nights. Considering the price it was better than expected. The staff at check in wasn't very efficient, but was very friendly. The rooms were clean, and reasonably up to date decor-wize. The area was okay and very easy to reach by car. All in all, a good deal if you're looking for somewhere affordable and clean to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Ramada Limited Baltimore
HotelInfo.Address: 6422 Baltimore National Parkway, Baltimore, MD 21228 (Formerly Knights Inn)
